title_full:
Aerial M

              —
              The Peel Sessions
            
              (Drag City)
label: Drag City
description:
Slint alum David Pajo's mythical '98 Peel Session - featuring rare full band versions of three classic Aerial M cuts - finally makes it to wax! Post-rock history, really.

Pajo only recorded one Aerial M Peel Session, dragging his tour-torn bandmates into the BBC Radio One studios in Spring of '98 to dub lush alternative versions of 'Skrag Theme', 'Vivea' and 'Safeless'. The tracks all featured on his early run - 'Skrag Theme was from his '97-released self-titled Aerial M debut, 'Safeless' from '98's... more

title_full:
SnPLO

              —
              Seven hundred and fifty loops
            
              (Pin)
label: Pin
description:
Hardgroover and dub techno types will be in their element with SnP 500 & PLO man’s tracky, loop-based DJ tools on their debut collaboration

‘Seven hundred and fifty loops’ mints SnPLO co-op label Pin with a brace of drum loops swept up in heady filter chicanery and FX. Built between respective bases in Montreal and Berlin, their first EP fathoms a range between trippy, hardgrooving disco-techno loops coruscating like a Porter Ricks cut, thru to more reserved, percolating pulses in a spectral... more

label: Tanum Records
description:
Heavy percussive flex from Winsome on his first record since 2017 ,out on Klaus' Tanum Records imprint.

"Who’s that finally wrestling tanum from the tyranical clutches of klaus? It’s winsome.

Coming in from the wilderness to deliver his first record since 2017, stepping off the path he’s been trodding through lovers rock to explore new territories of rhythm, sound and sub bass pressure."

            more

artist: Jeff Parker and ETA IVtet featuring Anna Butterss, Jay Bellerose and Josh Johnson
title_full:
Jeff Parker and ETA IVtet featuring Anna Butterss, Jay Bellerose and Josh Johnson

              —
              The Way Out of Easy
            
              (International Anthem)
label: International Anthem
description:
Recorded at LA's recently shuttered ETA, 'The Way Out of Easy' is a celebration of iconic guitarist Jeff Parker's seven year residency alongside Anna Butterss, Jay Bellerose and Josh Johnson, touching on the weekly sessions' transcendent, groove-fwd hybridity with canny nods to post-rock, kosmische, hip-hop and dub.

For decades at this point, Parker has been restlessly innovating both as a soloist and a keen collaborator, working with formative post-rock outfits like Isotope 217... more

release: If I don't make it, I love u
title_full:
Still House Plants

              —
              If I don't make it, I love u
            
              (Bison Records)
label: Bison Records
description:
Genuinely smart art school rock is hard to come by, but Still House Plants make it sound easy, welding subtly R&B-inflected vocals to fractured, free jazz-cum-post rock drums and Shellac-strength axe acrobatics on their incredible third album. Genius, just a bit.

There was a moment during post-rock's evolution when it felt as if the jazz influence that had been simmering in the background since the Talk Talk days was about to bubble over. Tortoise were making firmer connections with Chicago's... more

title_full:
Brainiac

            —
            Hissing Prigs In Static Couture

kim deal

              —
              Nobody Loves You More
            
              (4AD)
label: 4AD
description:
Kim Deal's long-awaited proper solo album is a late-career masterstroke, all candid and intimate material, but draped in lavish orchestral flourishes and canny nods to US pop history that pull us confidently away from her beloved canon.

Trust Deal to give us the ultimate fake-out while introducing a solo full-length we've been waiting on for decades. The first single, 'Coast', is the album's most mischievous, a wobbly wedding band flashback that seems to interpolate Blondie as Deal casts her mind... more

label: Isla
description:
Leading figures of Miami’s forward Latin club sound skew the dance to wickedly tricky rhythm & noise, twisting up cues from Italian library groves, orchestral Cuban ensembles, dancehall-dembow and dub - RIYL HHY & The Macumbas, El Gusano, Serpente, Treader’s electro-jazz fusions, Pekka Airaksinen,  Mark Ernetus Ndagga Rhythm Force, Can.

Precisely the sort of experimental club tackle we’ve been waiting to emerge from the promise of the Miami new skool, Crespi Drum Syndicate... more
